intro: Pavonia rutshuruensis, commonly known as the Rutshuru pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as forest understories and swampy areas. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
